148F4676C140420A9E141A0BC781440F.description: Apply knowledge and understanding of the complex number system to add, subtract, multiply, and divide complex numbers and solve problems.

DE3DCAC0CEED4F67B8886DC5A6D67D2B.description: Complete the square in an equation representing a circle to determine properties of the circle when it is graphed in the xy-plane, and use the distance formula in problems related to circles.

95B92732B2924FF1B8ACE029B2A03058.description: Convert between angle measures in degrees and radians.

38AF1F603BEE456B9164D492E53841F6.description: Understand that the ordered pairs that satisfy an equation of the form (x-h)2+(y-k)2=r2 form a circle when plotted in the xy-plane.

8E90AE2B1B324CAD93F0C42C71000245.description: Describe how a change in the graph of the circle affects the equation of the circle.

C0940CC151E840D0A4AB4433B9C71225.description: Describe how a change to the equation representing a circle in the xy-plane affects the graph of the circle;

AE653B4CBE254DF59B1484E7F8FCFD45.description: Create an equation to represent a circle in the xy-plane

0D6EA63954754637B14DEF8F18DC90C5.description: Solve problems using trigonometric ratios in the unit circle.

72D23974AC2044A38E5C587FEF66DB8A.description: Use definitions, properties, and theorems relating to circles and parts of circles, such as radii, diameters, tangents, angles, arcs, arc lengths, and sector areas, to solve problems;

5D47D20A4E174F3EAB17E71CCA1E0CAE.description: Fluently apply properties of special right triangles to determine side lengths and calculate triaonometric ratios of 30, 45, and 60 degrees.

FDF72C4F30FD4265AF4F5885026CEDD3.description: Solve problems using the relationship between sine and cosine of complementary angles.

1060D0A94729487D80A454DC44752C72.description: Understand that when given one side length and one acute angle measure in a right triangle, the remaining values can be determined.

0D7FFBB5554348A5B408DB8FC1C0BA0F.description: Use similarity to calculate values of sine, cosine, and tangent.

AF5911CA0DF545CFBC5C8C90307619BB.description: Solve problems in a variety of contexts using properties of special right triangles.

DC1B9094B16540AAA4A380CAF153BCCA.description: Solve problems in a variety of contexts using right triangle trigonometry;

91474950BD8B439DADD61DEEF8E0B39B.description: Solve problems in a variety of contexts using the Pythagorean theorem;

A3921FFE335B47D0A42D53652091CD46.description: Know and directly apply relevant theorems such as the relationship of angles formed when a transversal cuts parallel lines

972315E231644A0196310B3DCA05FF2E.description: Know and directly apply relevant theorems such as triangle angle sum theorem;

4B01447D1C884DE98885A14B95FB7082.description: Know and directly apply relevant theorems such as triangle similarity and congruence criteria;

BD65B66B1DC54F589CC444E2406CFEC6.description: Know and directly apply relevant theorems such as the vertical angle theorem;

C5C1DAF6C8D24503A2FAF10B501B5716.description: Apply knowledge that changing by a scale factor of k changes all lengths by a factor of k, but angle measures remain unchanged.

C0805221618F40379F803FB0174BAC6C.description: Determine which statements may be required to prove certain relationships or to satisfy a given theorem.

29907468BC994CC082972171CC7EB1AF.description: Use concepts and theorems relating to congruence and similarity of triangles to solve problems.

1CF519FC1341497C9472141D14ACE9AC.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems about a geometric figure or an object that can be modeled by a geometric figure using given information such as length, area, surface area, or volume. Demonstrate procedural fluency by selecting the correct area or volume formula and correctly calculating a specific value.

2FCF7F6B02934D74A73C73FDDC6C2DEC.description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems about a geometric figure or an object that can be modeled by a geometric figure using given information such as length, area, surface area, or volume. Apply knowledge that changing by a scale factor of k changes all lengths by a factor of k, changes all areas by a factor of k2, and changes all volumes by a factor of k3.

923F6F66F91A496296872AC6180CB841.description: For a factorable or factored polynomial or simple rational function, identify the graph given an algebraic representation of the function and an algebraic representation given the graph (with or without a context).

3631596A92C7413B946E5A2BD56AC8C0.description: For a factorable or factored polynomial or simple rational function, understand and use the face that for the graph of y=f(x), the solution to f(x)=0 corresponds to x-intercepts of the graph and f(0) corresponds to the y-intercept of the graph; interpret these key features in terms of a context;

0048F6043578403CA5F4D7940DA31E18.description: For a factorable or factored polynomial or simple rational function, use function notation to represent and interpret input/output pairs in terms of a context and points on the graph;

78B1077944F94F98AE4D48D3A73C9311.description: For a quadratic or exponential function, for a function that represents a context, interpret the meaning of an input/output pair, constant, variable, factor, or term based on the context, including situations where seeing structure provides an advantage;

370ED35A4A404D86BD1FD5B3EFA0D897.description: For a quadratic or exponential function, use function notation to represent and interpret input/output pairs in terms of a context and points on the graph;

1CBB0695A3C7449D86ACD7F39E990AD8.description: For a quadratic or exponential function, identify or create an appropriate function to model a relationship between quantities;

EEC4A555AD714A59ADA269285BD851A7.description: Create and use quadratic or exponential functions to solve problems in a variety of contexts.

FA628A533D434AAFB7F92B7D46C06F74.description: Fluently solve quadratic equations in one variable, written as a quadratic expression in standard form equal to zero, where using the quadratic formula or completing the square is the most efficient method for solving the equation.

D4C62E06BC7D439CA8F52C2BD3D793C3.description: Given an equation or formula in two or more variables that represents a context, view it as an equation in a single variable of interest where the other variables are parameters and solve for the variable of interest.

5B4430F9F86F4EAD97A66E6559B34560.description: Given a nonlinear equation in one variable that represents a context, interpret a solution, constant, variable, factor, or term based on the context, including situations where seeing structure provides an advantage.

E56A6E079DDB4B9BBBFC08E8A4676056.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to solve systems of linear and nonlinear equations in two variables, including relating the solutions to the graphs of the equations in the system.

541986C466404241B4C9E2BF65BA6366.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to solve linear absolute value equations in one variable.

8A143BCC723449F5B01812C54B29842B.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to solve polynomial equations in one variable that are written in factored form;

03D76475304D40F0A6F28E2C51D20F23.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to identify when procedures used to solve a simple rational or radical equation in one variable lead to an equation with solutions that do not satisfy the original equation (extraneous solutions);

1C246855014B4E6AA8A081DF85A3F58F.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to solve simple rational and radical equations in one variable;

F46BAF0279FF4FA09AD95C916E9B7A2D.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure, the properties of operations, and reasoning about equality to solve quadratic equations in one variable presented in a wide variety of forms; determine the conditions under which a quadratic equation has no real solutions, one real solution, or two real solutions;

2DB89A8BD5D14A6CB22016105F5BE370.description: Nonlinear equations in one variable and systems of equations in two variablesÂ

DA2B6A86E9EE4AB18D6C2D012C9D5F49.description: Fluently add, subtract, and multiply polynomials

FC35C51606254685BD46F85F8B3AFC19.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure and the properties of operations to identify and create equivalent expressions, including factoring polynomials

7BC31751FEA34896A2EBEE13666F1D41.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure and the properties of operations to identify and create equivalent expressions, including writing expressions with rational exponents and radicals

412A8F987ED040D9B6A61EC9920206E3.description: Make strategic use of algebraic structure and the properties of operations to identify and create equivalent expressions, including rewriting simple rational expressions

1ADDD64852CC4D19A6F24F63A2CED6D1.description: Understand why a result can be extended only to the population from which the sample was selected.

537CF459A7ED4151A9AF0DB761DA7885.description: Understand why random assignment provides evidence for causal relationship.

B832215F1DAF4107AA8C1ED161D09884.description: Given a description of a study with or without random assignment, determine whether there is evidence for a causal relationship.

2CC4132E322343ECAB51FBA2890B5577.description: With random samples, describe which population the results can be extended to.

5A45E48AF60F41388C621BA0421380B1.description: Evaluating statistical claims: observational studies and experiments

58C9FC604A7A48FCA26CC0E03AEA2295.description: Interpret margin of error; understand that a larger sample size generally leads to a smaller margin of error.

6F3F99FDE3D5470CA7EAE26A2A3E3530.description: Use sample mean and sample proportion to estimate population mean and population proportion. Utilize, but do not calculate, margin of error.

0DF5838414AB439D9C0BCD327F902AB3.description: Inference from sample statistics and margin of error

E6C16D1B747843C2B36914A9A68E8C69.description: Understand formulas for probability and conditional probability in terms of frequency.

7B02CE8699EE4A1F8BD209B91D0512CE.description: Compute and interpret probability and conditional probability in simple contexts.

C1FA402C21B2487DA5D9167BBCE8D7C6.description: Estimate the line of best fit for a given scatterplot; use the line to make predictions

EADBE31D4ECE4DB39C5C1EF740E7F83D.description: For a given function type (linear, quadratic, exponential), choose the function of that type that best fits given data.

5182B3D50BAC46A49D6D1AACDF75038F.description: Select a graph that represents a context, identify a value on a graph, or interpret information on the graph.

9CB737B796DA495EB7255253A54A0CD5.description: Analyze and interpret data represented in a scatterplot or line graph; fit linear, quadratic, and exponential models.

DDD8AA9F54494ED4AB527AACFE0EF59B.description: Given a relationship between two quantities, read and interpret graphs and tables modeling the relationship.

4617FEE93C4F4FF2BB21985942DE1B80.description: Interpret the slope and intercepts of the line of best fit on context.

EFE35509B908429BAF8919CE91E9FEFB.description: Using a model that fits the data in a scatterplot, compare values predicted by the model to values given in the data set.

02E2959EBA5A46FC963B90F83705A610.description: Given an appropriate data set, calculate the mean.

2B0B05C07C2F4E09A3DBBAEC368D7AE0.description: Understand and describe the effect of outliers on mean and median.

ABAD38AFFFD54450BA6015D389C8C891.description: Compare distributions using measures of center and spread, including distributions with different means and the same standard deviations and ones with the same mean and different standard deviations.

FBCD2A1A705D4170BB4BA007A2E082EF.description: For quantitative variables, calculate, compare, and interpret mean, median, and range. Interpret (but don't calculate) standard deviation.

53FD5B0C7E884FFBBD3C51FE0F5E1BC6.description: Analyze and interpret numerical data distribution represented with frequency tables, histograms, dot plots and box plots.

CAD41B8ED5744B52924D2A8A44E21D91.description: Interpret information from a given representation of data in context.

040A9131C6C34354B7AD81BFF1A75F1B.description: Choose an appropriate graphical representation for a given data set.

9FA02A093F214605BB98AFC7BA01FCEF.description: One-variable data: distribution and measures of center and spread

F09E5E106BAA4C6682066D30E85D89B2.description: Understand and use the relationship between percent change and growth factor (5% and 1.05, for example); include percentages greater than or equal to 100%.

E0719CECA4BF40FEA6511F2A19C7E632.description: Use percentages to solve problems in a variety of contexts. Examples include, but are not limited to, discounts, interest, taxes, tips, and percent increases and decreases for many different quantities.

E5E94410236B4218A5E2B255D33F8501.description: Understand and use the fact that when two quantities are in a proportional relationship, if one changes by a scale factor, then the other also changes by the same scale factor.

2055DB2C95364248A6232EA0B60959C6.description: Solve problems involving unit conversion, including currency exchange and conversion between different measurement systems.

26C349BBA1EB4807B378268C5DB2F37B.description: Solve problems involving derived units, including those that arise from products (e.g., kilowatt-hours) and quotients (e.g., population per square kilometer)

CA5D80E0BA184EA781C5B4391A0AD594.description: Apply proportional relationships, ratios, rates, and units in a wide variety of contexts. Examples include but are not limited to scale drawings and problems in the natural and social sciences.

1E31EF2B7E0C4836A9213256DC4D5DF1.description: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and unitsÂ

7774688DFCB146A5AFBE7C2E13C547D5.description: Given a linear inequality or system of linear inequalities, interpret a point in the solution set.

DC73CA0EDE95483B8A83FF85276AA5C8.description: Make connections between tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of linear inequalities in one or two variables by deriving one from the other.

0C1A8B6A324C4CD4B0FEE198E457CB9F.description: For linear inequalities in one or two variables, interpret a constant, variable, factor, or term, including situations where seeing structure provides an advantage.

DD1357D247744E2F926F457E91470972.description: Create linear inequalities in one or two variables, and when in context interpret the solution in terms of the context.

1664C421C5264511830B221051F5FE71.description: Linear inequalities in one or two variables

400D71A6507549F1B6E8900B25F859D7.description: For a system of linear equations in two variables, determine the conditions under which the system has no solutions, a unique solution, or infinitely many solutions.

1C131AE749734B3C8432BE2067A75706.description: For a system of linear equations in two variables, interpret a solution, constant, variable, factor, or term based on the context, including situations when seeing structure provides an advantage.

95E75377FBE4464E9C2AE7EB68F4DDCD.description: Solve a system of linear equations in two variables, making strategic use of algebraic structure.

5C139D4BE8AE4E27AD518FC2EE747013.description: Make connections between tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of the system by deriving one representation from the other.

12FBB3E3A6FB4D9DB73D2826147BB824.description: Create a system of linear equations in two variables, and when in context interpret solutions in terms of the context.

19E0C70567944F319ADC80E6AA16B087.description: Create and use a system of two linear equations in two variables to solve problems in a variety of contexts.

9B9B9C1DACBC44C4A6CBB25171A84698.description: Systems of two linear equations in two variables

C329B647C20442CBBE74FA968D49D1EE.description: Write an equation for a line given two points on the line, one point and the slope of the line, or one point and a parallel or perpendicular line.

494887864F484F199A52A12490415D16.description: Make connections between tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of a linear equation in two variables by determining how a graph is affected by a change to its equation.

740948E271574B6AA34BE50B10823417.description: Make connections between tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of a linear equation in two variables by identifying features of one representation given another representation;

F30CEA2230064EDDAA8050C7D6FADA55.description: Make connections between tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of a linear equation in two variables by deriving one representation from the other;

19B430D6F7E94C11B3E387C6DFD086C8.description: For a linear equation in two variables that represents a context, given a value of one quantity in the relationship, find a value of the other, if it exists.

B03EEC125D8B4124B529A5F48126F18B.description: For a linear equation in two variables that represents a context, interpret a solution, constant, variable, factor, or term based on the context, including situations where seeing structure provides and advantage;

15002CB6BB2E4765AB3F75BCD7A857B1.description: Create and use a linear equation in two variables to solve problems in a variety of contexts.

7C71DC055FC2435489ED6D3763320010.description: Make connections between verbal, tabular, algebraic, and graphical representations of a linear function by determining how a graph is affected by a change to its equation.
